intro: Camellia lanceisepala, commonly known as the lanceolate-sepal camellia, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped sepals and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in winter or early spring. The plant produces elliptical, dark green leaves that are leathery to the touch. Camellia lanceisepala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant. It prefers acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
